docs.snippet: Sinking of the Uruguayan merchant ship Maldonado by a German submarine, the commander of which forced the freighter's captain, at machine-gun point, to submit to being taken prisoner, was reported yesterday at Hamilton, Bermuda, by thirteen survivors...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sinking of the Uruguayan merchant ship Maldonado by a German submarine, the commander of which forced the freighter's captain, at machine-gun point, to submit to being taken prisoner, was reported yesterday at Hamilton, Bermuda, by thirteen survivors who had drifted five days before being rescued.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 8 (UP) -- A crowd of 2,000 persons stormed through the streets tonight in an anti-Axis demonstration while the government officially protested to Germany over the sinking of the Uruguayan ship Maldonado.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 8 (UP) -- A crowd of 2,000 persons stormed through the streets tonight in an anti-Axis demonstration while the government officially protested to Germany over the sinking of the Uruguayan ship Maldonado.
docs.abstract: Montevideo crowds riot; govt protests through Swiss diplomatic office and demands explanation of Capt Giambruno's detention; Min A Guani comments; US Hamilton consul aid asked; 22 more survivors landed, US east coast; 14 still missing

docs.snippet: An air-mail cover received by Colonel Hans Lagerloef from Ivar Sellergren, an army captain in Visby, Sweden, brings two stamps, 10-ore red and 90o pale blue, which Sweden has issued to commemorate the establishment of her public school system a...
docs.lead_paragraph: An air-mail cover received by Colonel Hans Lagerloef from Ivar Sellergren, an army captain in Visby, Sweden, brings two stamps, 10-ore red and 90o pale blue, which Sweden has issued to commemorate the establishment of her public school system a century ago.

headline.main: Sweden Honors Two Educators; Air-Mail Stamps Mark First Century of Her Public School System

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 9 (U.P.) -- Foreign Minister Alberto Guani said today that "since the torpedoing of the steamer Maldonado was pure and simple piracy, Uruguayan reprisals are in order."
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 9 (U.P.) -- Foreign Minister Alberto Guani said today that "since the torpedoing of the steamer Maldonado was pure and simple piracy, Uruguayan reprisals are in order."
